meanings.definition: Give evidence as a witness in a court of law.
meanings.sent1: During the trial, the witness will testify about what they saw.
meanings.sent2: The witness was asked to testify about the events that took place.
meanings.sent3: The parrot jokingly said it would testify if there were any bird-related crimes.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to testify to the passage of time with its gnarled branches.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprints on the glass would testify to who was present at the scene.

meanings.definition: Declare or give evidence in a solemn manner.
meanings.sent1: The priest will testify to the sanctity of the marriage ceremony.
meanings.sent2: She will testify her loyalty to the king in front of the court.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to testify to the seriousness of the situation with its stern meow.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to testify to the beauty of the evening sky.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins testify to the grandeur of the civilization that once thrived there.
